definitions: sport played with racquets and shuttlecock across a high net
examples: We played badminton in the backyard yesterday afternoon
She joined the badminton club at her local gym

definitions: plate or barrier that controls flow of fluid or sound
examples: The engineer installed a baffle in the exhaust system
Sound baffles reduced the noise level significantly

definitions: dense bread roll with hole in center often topped with seeds
examples: She ordered a toasted bagel with cream cheese
The bakery sells fresh bagels every morning

definitions: suitcases and bags taken when traveling somewhere
past experiences or problems that affect someone's behavior or relationships
examples: Please collect your baggage from carousel three
The airline lost our baggage during the flight
She brought emotional baggage into the new relationship
Years of therapy helped him unpack his baggage

definitions: person who puts groceries into bags at checkout counter
examples: The bagger carefully packed the eggs on top
She worked as a bagger during high school

definitions: coarse fabric or material used for making bags
act or process of putting items into bags or containers
examples: The farmer ordered burlap bagging for the grain harvest
Heavy-duty bagging protected the equipment during shipping
The bagging of groceries requires speed and care
Automated bagging systems increased production efficiency

definitions: musical instrument with air bag and pipes played by blowing
examples: The bagpipe player led the Scottish parade
Traditional bagpipe music filled the highland festival

definitions: long thin loaf of French bread with crispy crust
examples: She bought a fresh baguette from the bakery
The sandwich was made with a crusty baguette

definitions: basic monetary unit of Thailand equal to one hundred satang
examples: The meal cost two hundred baht at the restaurant
She exchanged dollars for baht at the airport

definitions: money paid to court allowing temporary release from jail before trial
arched handle of a bucket or similar container for carrying
examples: His family posted bail to get him released
The judge set bail at ten thousand dollars
The bail on the water bucket needs repair
She lifted the pail by its metal bail

definitions: outer wall or courtyard of a medieval castle or fortress
examples: Knights defended the bailey from invading forces
The castle's bailey contained workshops and stables

definitions: officer who maintains order in courtroom and handles legal duties
examples: The bailiff escorted the defendant into the courtroom
She works as a bailiff in the county courthouse

definitions: person's area of skill, knowledge, responsibility, or special interest in something
examples: Marketing strategy is definitely within her bailiwick
This technical problem falls outside my bailiwick

definitions: food used to attract fish or animals for catching
something used to lure or entice someone into a trap
examples: He put fresh bait on the fishing hook
Worms make excellent bait for catching trout
The free offer was just bait to get customers
Don't take the bait when someone tries to argue

definitions: act of deliberately annoying or provoking someone or an animal
examples: Online baiting has become a serious cyberbullying issue
The baiting of bears was outlawed centuries ago

definitions: person who makes and sells bread, cakes, and pastries professionally
examples: The baker arrives at work before dawn daily
Our local baker makes the best sourdough bread

definitions: place where bread and cakes are made and sold to customers
examples: The bakery on Main Street opens at six
Fresh croissants filled the bakery display case

definitions: process of cooking food in an oven using dry heat
extremely hot temperature or weather conditions that feel oppressive
examples: Baking requires precise measurements and timing
She learned baking from her grandmother's recipes
The baking heat made outdoor work nearly impossible
After hours of baking sun, they sought shade

definitions: close-fitting garment covering head and neck with holes for eyes
examples: The skier wore a balaclava for protection from wind
Bank robbers often wear balaclavas to hide identity

definitions: act of keeping steady position or making different things equal in importance
examples: Balancing on one foot requires core strength
The balancing of work and family takes effort

definitions: platform projecting from wall of building with railing around it
upper floor of seats in a theater or concert hall
examples: She grew tomatoes in pots on her apartment balcony
The hotel room had a balcony overlooking the ocean
We bought balcony tickets for the opera performance
The view from the balcony seats was excellent

definitions: large bundle of material tightly bound for storage or transport
examples: The farmer stacked hay bales in the barn
Cotton bales were loaded onto the cargo ship

definitions: heavy beam or timber used as a barrier or support
illegal motion by pitcher that advances baserunners in baseball
examples: The old barn had exposed balks supporting the roof
Heavy balks reinforced the mine shaft entrance
The umpire called a balk on the pitcher
His balk allowed the runner to advance

definitions: slow romantic song or poem that tells a story often about love
examples: The singer performed a beautiful ballad about lost love
Medieval ballads were passed down through generations

definitions: heavy material in ship's hold to improve stability and control
gravel or crushed rock used as foundation for railroad tracks
examples: The ship took on water ballast before the voyage
Concrete blocks served as ballast in the sailboat
Workers spread fresh ballast along the railway tracks
Heavy rain washed away some track ballast

definitions: female dancer who performs ballet professionally in classical dance productions
examples: The ballerina practiced her pirouettes for hours daily
She dreamed of becoming a prima ballerina

definitions: artistic dance form with precise movements and formal techniques
theatrical work or performance using ballet dancing to tell a story
examples: She studied ballet from age five at the academy
Ballet requires years of disciplined training
The ballet company performed Swan Lake last night
We have tickets for the new ballet premiere

definitions: game played with a ball especially baseball or similar sport
completely different situation or set of circumstances than before
examples: Let's go to the ballgame this Saturday afternoon
The ballgame was postponed due to rain
With new funding, it's a whole new ballgame
That changes everything - it's a different ballgame now

definitions: sport or activity of flying in a hot air balloon
rapid expansion or swelling to a much larger size
examples: They went ballooning over the valley at sunrise
Ballooning requires favorable weather conditions
The ballooning costs worried the project manager
Ballooning debt became a serious financial problem

definitions: process of voting by ballot to make decisions or elect candidates
examples: Balloting for union representatives begins next Monday
The balloting process ensures anonymous voting

definitions: stadium or field where baseball games are played professionally
approximate range or rough estimate of a number or amount
examples: The new ballpark holds forty thousand fans
We arrived at the ballpark early for batting practice
Give me a ballpark figure for the project cost
That estimate is in the right ballpark

definitions: pen with tiny ball bearing in tip that rolls ink onto paper
examples: She signed the contract with a blue ballpoint
Ballpoint pens rarely leak compared to fountain pens

definitions: large room used for formal dancing and social events or gatherings
examples: The wedding reception was held in the hotel ballroom
They took ballroom dancing lessons every Thursday

definitions: fragrant ointment or oil used to heal or soothe skin
something that brings comfort or relief to mind or spirit
examples: She applied healing balm to the burn
The lip balm protected against winter dryness
Music was a balm for her troubled soul
Kind words served as balm to his disappointment

definitions: very light wood from tropical tree used for models and rafts
examples: He built model airplanes from balsa wood sheets
The raft was constructed using balsa logs

definitions: fragrant resin from certain trees used in medicines and perfumes
plant with colorful flowers grown in gardens and containers
examples: The medicine contained balsam for its healing properties
Balsam fir trees produce aromatic resin
She planted balsam flowers along the garden border
The balsam bloomed in shades of pink and white

definitions: row of balusters topped by rail along edge of balcony, bridge, or staircase for safety and decoration
examples: The marble balustrade surrounded the grand staircase
She leaned against the balustrade overlooking the garden

definitions: sudden loud sound or noise from a hard hit or explosion
examples: The door slammed shut with a loud bam
We heard a bam when the car backfired

definitions: giant woody grass that grows in tropical regions used for building
examples: The panda bears eat bamboo shoots exclusively
They built furniture from sustainable bamboo wood

definitions: quality of being boring, predictable, and lacking in originality or interest
examples: The movie's banality made it hard to watch
He was tired of the banality of office small talk

definitions: strip of material used to bind up wounds or injuries
examples: The nurse applied a clean bandage to the cut
He wrapped his sprained ankle with an elastic bandage

definitions: large colored handkerchief or square of cloth worn on head or neck
examples: He wore a red bandana to keep sweat away
The cowboy tied a bandana around his neck

definitions: pattern of stripes or bands on animals, rocks, or objects
system of organizing things into groups based on similar characteristics
examples: The zebra's banding provides natural camouflage
Rock banding shows different geological periods
Salary banding helps structure employee compensation fairly
The school uses ability banding for math classes

definitions: person who robs travelers or steals, especially as member of gang
examples: The bandit held up the stagecoach at gunpoint
Police caught the bandits after the bank robbery

definitions: practice or actions of bandits including robbery and lawless violence
examples: Banditry plagued the mountain roads in earlier times
The government cracked down on highway banditry

definitions: person who leads and conducts a musical band during performances
examples: The bandleader counted off before each song began
Duke Ellington was a famous jazz bandleader

definitions: covered platform for a band to perform music outdoors, often in parks
examples: The brass band played from the Victorian bandstand
Summer concerts happen at the park bandstand weekly
